li.p: an entity has an obligation under a defined benefit plan when an employee has rendered service in return for the benefits promised under the plan. Paragraphs 70–74 deal with the attribution of benefit to individual periods of service in order to determine whether an obligation exists.
an entity should use actuarial assumptions to determine whether the entity will pay those benefits in future reporting periods (see paragraphs 75–98).
actuarial techniques allow an entity to measure the obligation with sufficient reliability to justify recognition of a liability.
